channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Go pushes passage of bills to address homelessness
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Sen. Bong Go pressed yesterday for the passage of measures that seek to address homelessness in the country through affordable financing schemes.

item.title: ERC chief tells Meralco, power utilities to refund customers
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Distribution utilities and electric cooperatives that violated billing rules during the lockdown will be asked to refund the overcharged amount to consumers, according to the Energy Regulatory Commission.

item.title: Students, teachers to get mental health services
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The Department of Education will provide mental health and psychosocial support services for students, teachers and other personnel ahead of the opening of classes on Aug. 24.

item.title: IATF considering face shield proposal for motorcycle backriders
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: A team working to find solutions to the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis has yet to issue guidelines that would allow motorcycle backriders, about three weeks since it had been supposedly approved in principle by the body.

item.title: Monitoring task force set up vs new swine flu
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The government’s task force on the coronavirus disease 2019 has approved the recommendation of the Department of Agriculture to adopt protocols and surveillance mechanisms to prevent the spread of a new strain of swine flu with pandemic potential.

item.title: Palace reiterates Duterte is neutral on ABS-CBN issue
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Appeals to renew the franchise of broadcast giant ABS-CBN should be directed to Congress, Malacañang said yesterday, as it reiterated that President Duterte remains “neutral” on the issue.

item.title: Government eyes 10 million virus tests in 10-12 months
item.author: Ding Cervantes
item.description: The government is eyeing 10 million virus tests within the next 10 to 12 months, with plans to cover “essential workers who are in frequent contact with crowds,” according to Vince Dizon, deputy chief implementer of the government’s coronavirus disease 2019 response.

item.title: SC tells Duterte, others: Answer petitions vs terror law
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: The Supreme Court yesterday ordered the consolidation of four petitions filed against the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 as it gave President Duterte and other respondents named in the petitions a period of 10 days from the time they receive copies of the petitions to defend the constitutionality of the new law.

item.title: House eyes additional DOH budget for testing, hospital beds
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: The House of Representatives is looking into providing additional funding to the Department of Health to boost its programs to combat the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic, lawmakers bared yesterday.

item.title: Philippines has 2nd highest SEA cases after Indonesia
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Malacañang will allow local government units to impose localized lockdowns to enforce minimum health standards amid the daily rapid increase in the number of coronavirus disease 2019 infections, an official said yesterday.
